result.execSummary:
The defendant Benito L Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling.  No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. No contact with the victim. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benito L Martinez

Matter set for JT today but parties indicate the matter is resolved and wish to go to plea/sentencing. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Ct 1 GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: Ct 1 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
4 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 2 years initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision. 

Conditions of extended supervision:
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with the victim.
Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed.

Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is eligible for CIP.
Defendant is eligible for SAP.
